intro: Synanthes, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Synanthes has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
